      • getMeanFeatureLength

        public double getMeanFeatureLength(org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList fl,
                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,int[]> genomeMap,
                          java.lang.String featureName)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.lang.Exception
        Prints stats and mean feature length for a given feature
        Parameters:
        fl - a org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList
        genomeMap - a HashMap where the keys are the reference sequence names and the values a zero-filled int [] the length of the associated reference sequence
        featureName - the feature-type to analyse (e.g. mRNA, exon, CDS, etc)
        Returns:
        the mean length of the requested feature name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • getMeanFeatureLength

        public double getMeanFeatureLength(org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList fl,
                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,int[]> genomeMap,
                          java.lang.String featureName,
                          java.io.File geneIds,
                          java.lang.String attribute)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.lang.Exception
        Prints stats and mean feature length for a given feature, but restricts it to a list of geneIds of interest
        Parameters:
        fl - a org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList
        genomeMap - a HashMap where the keys are the reference sequence names and the values a zero-filled int [] the length of the associated reference sequence
        featureName - the feature-type to analyse (e.g. mRNA, exon, CDS, etc)
        geneIds - a file of gene IDs, one per line
        attribute - the gff attribute that the gene IDs will be listed under, e.g. gene_id, transcript_id, etc
        Returns:
        prints out stats and returns the mean feature length of the featureName
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

                                 java.lang.String attribute,
                                 java.io.File secretedProteinsFile)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        fl - a org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList
        attribute - the name of the attribute that will make the genes unique (e.g. "name", gene_id, etc)
        secretedProteinsFile - a list of genes that you want to restrict your analysis to
        Returns:
        the mean intron length of your restricted gene list
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • calculateCodingRegion

        public double calculateCodingRegion(org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList featList,
                           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,int[]> codingMap,
                           java.lang.String attribute,
                           double genomeLength)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.lang.Exception
        Calculate the proportion of the genome that contains coding regions (from the start of the first exon to the end of the last exon)
        Parameters:
        featList - a org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList
        codingMap - a HashMap where the keys are the reference sequence names and the values a zero-filled int [] the length of the associated reference sequence
        attribute - the name of the attribute that will make the genes unique (e.g. "name", gene_id, etc)
        genomeLength - the length of the genome
        Returns:
        the proportion of the genome which contains exons
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • getBlocks

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> getBlocks(org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList fl,
                                                                                   java.lang.String featureType)
        Creates start/end blocks of features
        Parameters:
        fl - a org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList
        featureType - the type of feature to make blocks from
        Returns:
        a HashMap of blocks where the keys are the names of the reference sequences and the values are arrays of Integers with the consecutive start and then finish co-ordinates of all the requested featureTypes

      • getBlocks

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> getBlocks(org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList fl,
                                                                                   java.lang.String featureType,
                                                                                   java.lang.String attribute,
                                                                                   java.util.Set secretedProteins)
        Creates start/end blocks of features
        Parameters:
        fl - a org.biojava3.genome.parsers.gff.FeatureList
        featureType - the type of feature to make blocks from
        attribute - the name of the attribute that will make the genes unique (e.g. "name", gene_id, etc)
        secretedProteins - a list of genes that you want to restrict your analysis to
        Returns:
        a HashMap of blocks where the keys are the names of the reference sequences and the values are arrays of Integers with the consecutive start and then finish co-ordinates of all the requested featureTypes
